creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: plate decorated with underglaze blue; attendant approaching three exotic birds; border with bird and figure cartouche
text: The design for this plate is the first drawing the Dutch artist Cornelis Pronk is thought to have supplied to the Dutch East India Company in 1734, known as "The Lady with the Parasol." The Pronk design, although intended to have an Asian feeling , is clearly western in execution, as the central scene depicts a servant holding a parasol over a Chinese lady who is feeding three birds, two of European origin, in front of European bulrushes.
title: "La Dame au Parasol" plate
